content:
staff ReportSeptember  

In CharlestonsSept PERIOD 5city council meeting the council will address resolutions for street closures during various parades as well as city drainage and lime plant treatment issues PERIOD

The resolution to temporarily close certain streetsfor three parades are as follows  p.m PERIOD to 6p.m.on Sept PERIOD  forCharleston Community High SchoolsannualHomecoming Parade  a.m PERIOD to 12p.m.on Oct PERIOD  forEasternsannualHomecoming Parade  to 1030a.m PERIOD on Oct PERIOD  forJefferson Elementary Grade Schoolsannual Halloween Parade PERIOD

A proposed ordinance to solve the Westchester Subdivisions issues will also be looked at.According tothe ordinance It is necessary to acquire a drainage easement in order to be able to construct and maintain the necessary storm sewer to alleviate these detention issues. a resolution to purchaselime sludge land application equipment to be used by local farmerswill also be on the table at this meeting PERIOD

The equipment would help avoid thecost of having the sludge removed from theWater Treatment Plant by the state which costs anaverage of  each yearaccording tothe resolution PERIOD

The equipment will cost up to80000 in FY 18according tothe resolution PERIOD

A proclamation byMayor Brandon Combsto recognize Constitution Week Sept PERIOD  through  due tothe two hundred and thirtieth anniversary of the drafting of the Constitution of the United States of America by the Constitutional Convention is also on the agenda PERIOD

The News Staff can be reached at  or emailprotected PERIOD
